alert.note: Alert for Florence; Marinette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 8:36PM CDT until April 21 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Pine River near Florence affecting Florence County. Menominee River near McAllister affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near Niagara affecting Florence, Marinette, Dickinson and Menominee Counties. Peshtigo River near Porterfield affecting Marinette County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Menominee River near Koss affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near Vulcan affecting Marinette, Dickinson and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near Florence affecting Florence, Dickinson and Iron Counties. For the Menominee River...including Twin Falls Dam-Iron Mountain, Florence, Vulcan, Niagara, Pembine, Menominee River at White Rapids Dam, Koss, McAllister...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menominee River near Niagara. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, water approaches the parking lot of the Union Protestant Church. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 11.1 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.
